input: What are the major challenges for tourism in Catanduanes?
output: The major challenges are the province's vulnerability to natural calamities (typhoons), which discourages visitors, and the resulting diversion of funding to rehabilitation instead of promotion.

summary_offline: Major challenges include the province's vulnerability to natural calamities (typhoons) and the diversion of funds from promotion to rehabilitation.

input: Saan ako pwedeng lumangoy sa Catanduanes?

input: Saan pwedeng mag-surf sa Catanduanes?
output: Ang Puraran Beach ay sikat na surf spot at tinawag na 'Majestic.' May international surfing competitions dito tuwing October-March. Baguhan at expert surfers ay welcome!
title: Surfing Locations (Tagalog)
summary_offline: Puraran Beach (Majestic) - world-class surfing, Oct-Mar season

input: Where can I surf in Catanduanes?
output: Puraran Beach, known as 'Majestic,' is a world-class surf spot. It hosts international competitions during October-March. Perfect for both beginners and experts!
title: Surfing Locations
summary_offline: Puraran Beach (Majestic) - world-class surfing, Oct-Mar season

input: beginner ba pwede mag-surf dito?
output: Oo! Maraming surf schools sa Puraran Beach na nag-aalok ng lessons para sa beginners. May board rentals din at mga instructor na tutulong sa'yo.
title: Beginner Surfing
summary_offline: Beginner-friendly surf lessons available at Puraran Beach

input: Kailan best time para mag-surf?
output: Best time ay October hanggang March, peak ng Pacific swell season. Mas mataas ang alon during these months. April-September ay mas kalma ang dagat.
title: Best Surfing Season
summary_offline: Best surfing: October-March (Pacific swell season)

input: What are the best tourist spots in Catanduanes?
output: The top tourist spots include Binurong Point, Puraran Beach, Tuwad-Tuwadang Blue Lagoon, Bato Church, and Nahulugan Falls.
title: Top Tourist Spots
summary_offline: Recommended tourist spots include Binurong Point, Puraran Beach, Tuwad-Tuwadang Blue Lagoon, Bato Church, and Nahulugan Falls.

input: Ano ang masarap kainin sa Catanduanes?
output: Subukan mo ang Vurong (native taro), Pansit Catandungan, fresh seafood, at Sihi (razor clams). May local delicacies din tulad ng Pilipit at Toasted Siopao.
title: Local Food (Tagalog)
summary_offline: Local specialties: Vurong, Pansit Catandungan, seafood, Sihi, Pilipit, Toasted Siopao

input: What are the best local foods in Catanduanes?
output: Try Vurong (native taro), Pansit Catandungan, fresh seafood, and Sihi (razor clams). Local delicacies include Pilipit and Toasted Siopao.
title: Local Food
summary_offline: Local specialties: Vurong, Pansit Catandungan, seafood, Sihi, Pilipit, Toasted Siopao

input: saan pwedeng kumain ng masarap?
output: Sa Virac, subukan ang Cris Snack Inn, Mamita's Garden Cafe, at Yellow Hauz. Para sa seafood, pumunta sa Puraran area. May mga karinderya din na mura pero masarap.
title: Where to Eat (Casual Tagalog)
summary_offline: Recommended restaurants: Cris Snack Inn, Mamita's Garden Cafe, Yellow Hauz, Puraran area for seafood

input: May vegetarian food ba?
output: Oo, maraming resto ang may vegetarian options. Ang Vurong ay vegetable-based. May fresh veggies din sa local market na pwede mong ipagawa.
title: Vegetarian Food
summary_offline: Vegetarian options available, Vurong is vegetable-based

input: Saan ako pwedeng matulog sa Catanduanes?
output: May mga resort sa Puraran tulad ng Majestic Puraran Beach Resort at Puraran Surf Beach Resort. Sa Virac town proper, may Hotel Balai Mariyat at Rakdell Pension House.
title: Accommodation (Tagalog)
summary_offline: Puraran: Majestic Resort, Puraran Surf Resort. Virac: Hotel Balai Mariyat, Rakdell Pension

input: Where can I stay in Catanduanes?
output: In Puraran, try Majestic Puraran Beach Resort or Puraran Surf Beach Resort. In Virac town, there's Hotel Balai Mariyat and Rakdell Pension House.
title: Accommodation
summary_offline: Puraran: Majestic Resort, Puraran Surf Resort. Virac: Hotel Balai Mariyat, Rakdell Pension

input: Magkano ang hotel dito?
output: Php 500-1,500 para sa budget pension houses. Php 2,000-5,000 para sa beach resorts. May mga homestays din na mas mura, around Php 300-800 per night.
title: Hotel Prices
summary_offline: Budget: 500-1500. Resorts: 2000-5000. Homestays: 300-800 per night

input: May camping ba dito?
output: Oo! Pwede mag-camp sa Puraran Beach at iba pang beaches. May camping fee na around Php 100-200. Magdala ng sariling tent o pwede rin mag-rent.
title: Camping
summary_offline: Camping available at beaches, 100-200 fee, bring tent or rent

input: Paano pumunta ng Catanduanes?
output: Sakay ng flight mula Manila to Virac Airport (1 hour) via Philippine Airlines or Cebu Pacific. O kaya by ferry from Tabaco Port, Albay (2-3 hours).
title: How to Get There (Tagalog)
summary_offline: By air: Manila to Virac (1hr). By sea: Tabaco to San Andres port (2-3hrs)

input: How do I get to Catanduanes?
output: Fly from Manila to Virac Airport (1 hour) via Philippine Airlines or Cebu Pacific. Or take a ferry from Tabaco Port, Albay (2-3 hours).
title: How to Get There
summary_offline: By air: Manila to Virac (1hr). By sea: Tabaco to San Andres port (2-3hrs)

input: Paano pumunta sa Puraran Beach from Virac?
output: Mag-van ka sa terminal (Php 80-100), 1-1.5 hours ang byahe. Pwede rin mag-habal-habal (motorcycle) o mag-rent ng tricycle for Php 800-1,200.
title: Virac to Puraran
summary_offline: Van: 80-100 (1-1.5hrs). Habal-habal or tricycle: 800-1200

input: May public transportation ba dito?
output: Oo, may vans, jeepneys, at tricycles. Vans ay regular routes between towns. Tricycles para sa short trips. Habal-habal (motorcycle taxi) para sa remote areas.
title: Public Transport
summary_offline: Available: vans (inter-town), tricycles (short trips), habal-habal (remote areas)

input: Ano ang dapat kong bisitahin sa Catanduanes?

input: may waterfalls ba dito?

input: first time ko dito, ano dapat gawin?

input: budget travel tips?
output: Mag-stay sa homestays (Php 300-500). Kumain sa karinderya (Php 50-100/meal). Sumakay ng public van instead of rent. Budget mo: Php 1,500-2,000 per day all-in.
title: Budget Travel Tips
summary_offline: Budget: 1500-2000/day. Stay homestays, eat karinderya, use public transport

input: safe ba dito para sa solo travelers?
